metadata.title: CVE-2012-6070 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Falconpl before 0.9.6.9-git20120606 misuses the libcurl API which may allowremote attackers to interfere with security checks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6070` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

falconpl - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-curl - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dbi - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dbi-firebird - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dbi-mysql - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dbi-postgresql - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dbi-sqlite3 - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dbus - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-dmtx - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-gd2 - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-gtk - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-hpdf - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-mongodb - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
falconpl-sdl - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
libfalcon-engine1 - 0.9.6.9-git20120606-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: falconpl package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.6.9-git20120606-2').
